original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 340/345 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee was quoted at 340/345 to the US dollar in the spot market in late morning trade Thursday, after opening around the same levels, dealers said.
The rupee was closed around 339 to the US dollar on Wednesday.
Business was done at 340 in spot and 337 to the dollar in the cash market, dealers said.
Commercial banks were were buying dollar telegraphic transfers at 335 and selling at 355 rupees.
The rupee appreciated steeply from around 363 to 320 levels after the central bank lifted a surrender rule two weeks ago, leading to a heavy sell-of.
On Wednesday interbank spot volume fell to 3.65 million dollars.
The central bank said it had bought around 500 million US dollars over two weeks more than it bought through a surrender rule in a month on a disclosed peg.
Sri Lanka’s monetary policy in general favours a stronger rupee due to negative private credit and an overnight liquidity short that can absorb money created by dollar purchases. (Colombo/Mar16/2023)
